thread.title: Incredible breaking waves cloud formation wows Palmy residents - Yahoo New Zealand
thread.title_full: Incredible breaking waves cloud formation wows Palmy residents - Yahoo New Zealand

author: Yahoo New Zealand On February
title: Incredible breaking waves cloud formation wows Palmy residents - Yahoo New Zealand
text:
Incredible breaking waves cloud formation wows Palmy residents - Yahoo New Zealand A rare cloud formation over Palmerston North has wowed residents. Close 
The cloud formations are called Kelvin-Helmholtz Waves, which look like waves crashing at the beach. Kelvin-Helmholtz Waves in Palmerston North. Photo: Helen Hardy 
1 NEWS weather presenter Dan Corbett said the clouds are caused by strong winds in a stable environment with warmer air just above the clouds. WOW! Fantastic shot of Kelvin-Helmholtz Waves shot by Carl Gadsby in Palmerston North! What are these? Find out: https://t.co/SY85BUbkoU ^CF pic.twitter.com/YrzewTntWX 
With the waves, the moist air is rolling over the cloud creating a wave-like formation. 
The photo appeared to be taken early in the morning when temperatures were still cooler. 
"It's pretty impressive, alright. It's probably one of the best Kelvin-Helmholtz waves I have ever seen," MetService meteorologist Tuporo Marsters said.
